docs.lead_paragraph: The Medicare hospital insurance trust fund may be depleted by 2017 and Social Security reserves gone by 2037, a new report from trustees says.

headline.main: Recession Drains Social Security and Medicare
headline.print_headline: Recession Erodes 2 Largest Funds In U.S. Safety Net

docs.snippet: The Medicare hospital insurance trust fund may be depleted by 2017 and Social Security reserves gone by 2037, a new report from trustees says.

docs.lead_paragraph: Shares of Bank of New York Mellon and U.S. Bancorp fell Tuesday after the two banks sold additional common stock to build up their capital as they begin preparing to pay back government bailout money.

headline.main: Shares of 2 Banks Decline After Stock Offerings

docs.abstract: Shares of Bank of New York Mellon and U.S. Bancorp fell Tuesday after the two banks sold additional common stock to build up their capital as they begin preparing to pay back government bailout money.
docs.snippet: Shares of Bank of New York Mellon and U.S. Bancorp fell Tuesday after the two banks sold additional common stock to build up their capital as they begin preparing to pay back government bailout money.

docs.lead_paragraph: It's unlikely that any group of professionals is happier to highlight the dullness of their work than small-town bankers.

headline.main: We're Dull, Small Banks Say, but Least We're Profitable

docs.abstract: Community banks, most of which eschewed the risk-addicted style of Wall Street megabanks, are still turning a reliable, if unexciting, profit. But many are dismayed that the public and politicians are lumping them in with struggling behemoths.
docs.snippet: Community banks, most of which eschewed the risk-addicted style of Wall Street megabanks, are still turning a reliable, if unexciting, profit. But many are dismayed that the public and politicians are lumping them in with struggling behemoths.

docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Charles Schumer is on the right track. It should be possible to design a system in which public and private plans could compete without destroying private coverage.

headline.main: A Moderate Plan for Health Care
headline.print_headline: A Moderate Plan for Health Care

docs.snippet: Senator Charles Schumer is on the right track. It should be possible to design a system in which public and private plans could compete without destroying private coverage.

docs.lead_paragraph: Lawmakers in the party’s moderate-to-conservative wing said they were “increasingly troubled” by their exclusion from the development of legislation to remake the health care system.

docs.lead_paragraph: Community banks have hardly suffered in the credit crisis, in part because they prefer to be boring — and safe.
